snippet: Dozens were reportedly killed, prompting exile opposition groups to push further for international military action.
abstract: Syrian opposition activists say soldiers and pro-government thugs rounded up scores of civilians in the devastated central city of Homs overnight, assaulted men and women, then killed dozens of them, including children; Syrian government denies responsibility, attributing the killings to 'terrorist armed groups'; attack prompts a major exile opposition group to sharpen calls for international intervention.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hala Droubi, Hwaida Saad and Kareem Fahim from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London, Dan Bilefsky and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul, Steven Lee Myers from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Dozens were reportedly killed, prompting exile opposition groups to push further for international military action.

headline.seo: Massacre Is Reported in Homs, Syria
headline.main: Massacre Is Reported in Homs, Raising Pressure for Intervention in Syria
headline.print_headline: Massacre Is Reported in Homs, Raising Pressure for Intervention in Syria
